frame.name: Emotion_directed
frame.definition:
<def-root>The adjectives and nouns in this frame describe an <fen>Experiencer</fen> who is feeling or experiencing a particular emotional response to a <fen>Stimulus</fen> or about a <fen>Topic</fen>. There can also be a <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the response occurs or a <fen>Reason</fen> that the <fen>Stimulus</fen> evokes the particular response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Experiencer">Mr. Whiskers</fex> is <t>upset</t> <fex name="Stimulus">that there are no more cat treats</fex>.</ex> <ex>The <t>furious</t> <fex name="Experiencer">parent</fex> stormed into the office.</ex> <ex><fex name="Experiencer">Franz</fex> gets <t>infuriated</t> <fex name="Circumstances">at the thought of his ex-wife remarried</fex>.</ex> <ex> She flashed a <t>jubilant</t> <fex name="Expressor">smile</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Experiencer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
<ex>Nan Ho turned, <fex name="Exp">his</fex> extreme <t>agitation</t> unnoticed by the Prince.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs. It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
<ex>I was <t>angry</t> <fex name="Topic">about the war</fex>.</ex> <ex>So tell the world, and its <t>boredom</t> <fex name="Top">about your troubles</fex> will heal you.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Stimulus
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
<ex>Liz's <t>anger</t> <fex name="Stim">towards Raquel</fex> dates back to a charity dinner this year.</ex> <ex>The feeling the bereaved find most difficult to acknowledge is their <t>anger</t> <fex name="Stim">against the dead person</fex> for abandoning them to face the world alone.</ex> <ex>Jack Smith openly discussed his innermost <t>anguish</t> <fex name="Stim">at being one of only three England players not to kick a ball during finals</fex>.</ex> <ex>David filled her dreams; the ecstasy of their lovemaking, and the pain and <t>bewilderment</t> <fex name="Stim">of his abrupt departure</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> is the degree to which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> feels the emotion.
<ex>Nan Ho turned, his <fex name="Degr">extreme</fex> <t>agitation</t> unnoticed by the Prince .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Empathy_target
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Empathy_target</fen> is the individual or individuals with which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> identifies emotionally and thus shares their emotional response.
<ex>I am <t>happy</t> <fex name="Empathy_target">for Sara</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Expressor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Frame Element <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a body part, gesture or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state. They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
<ex>"Can I help you?" she asked, trying not to let him see the <t>amusement</t> <fex name="Exr">in her blue eyes</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> is the explanation for why the <fen>Stimulus</fen> evokes a certain emotional response.
<ex>The feeling the bereaved find most difficult to acknowledge is their <t>anger</t> against the dead person <fex name="Explanation">for abandoning them to face the world alone</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> is the condition(s) under which the <fen>Stimulus</fen> evokes its response. In some cases it may appear without an explicit <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
<ex>One career wife spoke about her <t>exasperation</t> <fex name="Circumstances">when her husband listened to her with half an ear as he watched television</fex>.</ex> <ex>Bob is <t>infuriated</t> <fex name="Circumstances">whenever I play loud music</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: State
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
<ex><fex name = "Experiencer">Tracy</fex> was in an <t>irritated</t> <fex name="State">mood</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in. <ex>The end of the film was filled with <t>jubilant</t> <fex name="Event">scenes</fex>.</ex> [Here we know that the scenes are filled with jubilant <fex name="Experiencer">Experiencers</fex>.]</def-root>

FE.name: Parameter
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Parameter</fen> is a domain in which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> is the way in which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: disappointed.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: sad or displeased because one's hopes or expectations have not been fulfilled.

lexUnit.name: pleased.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: feeling or showing pleasure and satisfaction.

lexUnit.name: upset.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be angry or unhappy because of a certain situation

lexUnit.name: excited.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: filled with feelings of enthusiasm and eagerness

lexUnit.name: relaxed.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: feeling little tension or anxiety; calm and comfortable

lexUnit.name: revolted.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: filled with disgust and shock

lexUnit.name: shocked.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: filled with horror, surprise, or digust

lexUnit.name: sickened.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: filled with revulsion and disgust

lexUnit.name: disconsolate.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: very unhappy and unable to be comforted.

lexUnit.name: wretched.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: in a very unhappy or unfortunate state; miserable.

lexUnit.name: despondent.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: in low spirits from loss of hope or courage.

lexUnit.name: overwrought.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: in a state of nervous excitement or anxiety.

lexUnit.name: inconsolable.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not able to be comforted or consoled.

lexUnit.name: happy.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: feeling or showing pleasure or contentment.

lexUnit.name: revulsion.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sense of disgust and loathing.

lexUnit.name: vexation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being vexed or annoyed

lexUnit.name: anger.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a strong feeling of annoyance, displeasure, or hostility.

lexUnit.name: annoyance.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being annoyed

lexUnit.name: despondency.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: depression from loss of hope or courage.

lexUnit.name: elation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a state of joyfulness and hapiness

lexUnit.name: bewilderment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: in a state of confusion and uncertainty

lexUnit.name: perplexity.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being puzzled or perplexed.

lexUnit.name: puzzlement.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being confused and bewildered

lexUnit.name: stupefaction.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being extremely astonished

lexUnit.name: mystification.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being bewildered of perplexed

lexUnit.name: disgruntlement.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being disgruntled or discontented

lexUnit.name: disorientation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being confused about one's position in the world.

lexUnit.name: discouragement.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a state of having been deprived of hope or courage.

lexUnit.name: glumness.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: being in a state of dejection

lexUnit.name: disconcertion.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being disconcerted

lexUnit.name: displeasure.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a feeling of annoyance or dissatisfaction.

lexUnit.name: dejection.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being depressed and dejected

lexUnit.name: sorrow.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a feeling of deep distress caused by loss or disappointment.

lexUnit.name: embarrassment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being self-conscious and ill at ease

lexUnit.name: exhilaration.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being excited and elated

lexUnit.name: disappointment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a feeling of being disappointed

lexUnit.name: exasperation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being angry or irritated

lexUnit.name: agitation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being emotionally disturbed

lexUnit.name: amusement.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state or experience of finding something funny.

lexUnit.name: boredom.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being weary from repition or tediousness

lexUnit.name: excitement.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a state of emotional arousal

lexUnit.name: gratification.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being pleased and satisfied

lexUnit.name: horror.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an intense feeling of fear, shock, or disgust or intense dismay.

lexUnit.name: sadness.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the feeling of being sad

lexUnit.name: sympathy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: feelings of pity and sorrow for someone else's misfortune

lexUnit.name: ashamed.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: embarrassed or guilty because of one's actions or characteristics.

lexUnit.name: bewildered.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: experiencing disturbing confusion and puzzlement

lexUnit.name: chagrin.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: annoyance or shame at having failed

lexUnit.name: covetous.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: feeling a desire to posses something or for something to happen, in response to some other object or event

lexUnit.name: despair.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the complete loss or absence of hope

lexUnit.name: disoriented.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: experiencing confusion regarding position or location

lexUnit.name: ecstatic.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: feeling great feelings of happiness and joy

lexUnit.name: embittered.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: filled with bitterness and resentfulness

lexUnit.name: exasperated.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: filled with irritation or annoyance.

lexUnit.name: exhilarated.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: filled with feelings of excitement and enthusiasm

lexUnit.name: gratified.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: filled with pleasure and satisfaction

lexUnit.name: heartbroken.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: suffering from overwhelming distress; very upset.

lexUnit.name: indignant.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: filled with annoyance at unfair treatment

lexUnit.name: infuriated.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: filled with rage and anger

lexUnit.name: grief.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: intense sorrow, especially caused by someone's death.

lexUnit.name: mourning.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the experience or expression of deep sorrow for someone who has died.

lexUnit.name: sympathetic.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: feeling, showing, or expressing sympathy.

lexUnit.name: saddened.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: experiencing an increase in sadness

lexUnit.name: mournful.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: feeling or expressing grief or sadness

lexUnit.name: nettled.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be annoyed at someone or something

lexUnit.name: offended.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: filled with hurt, resentment or displeasure

lexUnit.name: interest.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a quality exciting curiosity or holding the attention

lexUnit.name: fed up.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: dissatisfied as a result of having to endure for a long time.

lexUnit.name: bitterness.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being resentful

lexUnit.name: OK.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: A sentient being at peace with itself

lexUnit.name: fine.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: A sentient being wihtout any identified or identifiable detractors.

lexUnit.name: misery.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A destitute or depressing situation.

lexUnit.name: grim.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: Seemingly hopeless, or without a conceivable positive outlook.
